title: 14-year-old boy 'critical' after Jersey City shooting; one charged
content:
JERSEY CITY -- A 14-year-old boy is in critical condition following a shooting on Ocean Avenue Tuesday night, officials said.
The victim, a Bostwick Avenue resident, was shot in the chest at around 7 p.m. near Wilkinson Avenue, Jersey City spokeswoman Jennifer Morrill said.
Shortly after the shooting, police found 19-year-old Jamantay Gaines, of Palisade Avenue, holding a handgun on Bidwell Avenue. He was arrested and charged with possession of a weapon and possession of a weapon for an unlawful purpose, Morrill said.
A 30-year-old man was shot in the ankle near Bergen and Lexington avenues early Tuesday morning, officials said.
The 14-year-old remains hospitalized at Jersey City Medical Center, where he is listed in critical, but stable, condition, Morrill said.
The shooting was at least the third in the city this week. A man crashed his car into a utility pole on Grand Street Monday morning after someone opened fire on his black Acura. Then early Tuesday morning, a 30-year-old man was shot in the ankle near Bergen and Lexington avenues.
